ðŸš€ pinstr | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Curating and sharing interests with others in a decentralized social network.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Decentralized backend with Nostr protocol â€¢ Open-source and free to use â€¢ Create customized public boards of pins on almost any topic â€¢ Like, Comment, and Zap other users' boards
ðŸ“– Summary: Pinstr is a decentralized, open-source social network built on the Nostr protocol, designed for users to curate and share their interests. It allows users to create customized boards, engage with others through likes, comments, and Zaps, and attach Nostr profiles and notes to their boards. The platform aims to provide an easy-to-use interface for discovering and organizing new ideas and recommendations.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ monolith | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Saving complete web pages for offline access and archival purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Saves web pages as single HTML files â€¢ Embeds CSS, images, and JavaScript assets â€¢ Creates self-contained HTML5 documents â€¢ Assets embedded as data URLs for offline viewing
ðŸ“– Summary: Monolith is a CLI tool and library that saves complete web pages as single, self-contained HTML files. It embeds all CSS, image, and JavaScript assets directly into the HTML, allowing for offline viewing and easy sharing. This eliminates broken links and ensures the page renders correctly even without an internet connection.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ x8 | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Identifying hidden parameters in web applications for security testing and bug bounty hunting.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fast â€¢ Flexible request configuration through templates and injection points â€¢ Highly scalable â€¢ High accuracy compared to similar tools â€¢ Discovers parameters with non-random values
ðŸ“– Summary: x8 is a Rust-based hidden parameter discovery suite designed for web security testing. It offers features like flexible request configuration, high scalability, and accurate detection of hidden parameters, even those with non-random values. The tool aims to help security professionals uncover potential vulnerabilities and interesting functionalities often missed by other tools.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ Cosmos-Server | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Secure and easy self-hosting of a home server with application management, reverse proxy, and authentication features.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ App Store for easy app installation and management â€¢ Storage Manager with Parity Disks and MergerFS support â€¢ Network Storages based on RClone for remote access â€¢ Reverse-Proxy with automatic HTTPS
ðŸ“– Summary: Cosmos-Server provides a secure and user-friendly platform for self-hosting applications on a home server. It offers features like an app store, storage management, reverse proxy with automatic HTTPS, and a robust authentication server. It aims to simplify self-hosting while prioritizing security and ease of use.
